problem.p: A block of mass M is initially at rest on a spring of spring constant k that has been compressed a distance x from its equilibrium length. The spring is released, and shoots the block to a height h above the uncompressed position of the top of the spring. The goal of this problem is to determine the height h in terms of the other quantities and gravity. What is the most appropriate way to decompose the problem?
My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: a. Mechanical energy is conserved throughout.
b. It is necessary to find the speed of the block as it leaves the spring.
c. The forces change when the block leaves the spring.
d. The acceleration drops to zero at the top.
e. Statements b, c and d are all needed to explain the decomposition.
